SEARCH
Module com.example.teach
Package com.example.teach.model

Class User

java.lang.Object
com.example.teach.model.User
Direct Known Subclasses:
Student, Teacher
public abstract class User extends Object
Abstract base class for all users in the DeepSeekers system (students and teachers).

Encapsulates common properties such as ID, password hash, first name, last name, and email. Provides authentication and registration logic, as well as password hashing utility.

  • Constructor Details

    • User

      public User(String id, String passwordHash, String firstName, String lastName, String email)
      Constructs a new User with the given credentials and personal information.
      Parameters:
      id - unique user identifier (prefix enforced by subclass)
      passwordHash - SHA-256 hash of the user's password
      firstName - user's first name
      lastName - user's last name
      email - user's email address

    • login

      public static User login(String id, String passwordHash)
      Attempts to authenticate a user with the given ID and password hash.
      Parameters:
      id - user ID
      passwordHash - SHA-256 hash of the provided password
      Returns:
      a User instance (Student or Teacher) if authentication succeeds; null otherwise

    • signUp

      public static User signUp(String id, String passwordHash, String firstName, String lastName, String email, List<String> subjectIds)
      Registers a new user in the system, enforcing role-based rules: students must supply exactly 4 subjects; teachers exactly 1.
      Parameters:
      id - new user ID (must start with 'S' or 'T')
      passwordHash - SHA-256 hash of the password
      firstName - user's first name
      lastName - user's last name
      email - user's email address
      subjectIds - list of subject IDs (size 4 for students, 1 for teachers)
      Returns:
      the created User (Student or Teacher) on success; null on failure

    • hashPassword

      public static String hashPassword(String password)
      Hashes the given plain-text password using SHA-256 and returns its hex-encoded digest.
      Parameters:
      password - the plain-text password to hash
      Returns:
      hex-encoded SHA-256 digest
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if SHA-256 algorithm is not available

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation including user details and role-specific info.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      formatted string for Student or Teacher
